intro: The v-chip-group supercharges the v-chip component by providing groupable functionality. It is used for creating groups of selections using chips.

column.heading: Column
column.intro: Chip groups with column prop can wrap their chips.

filter.heading: Filter results
filter.intro: Easily create chip groups that provide additional feedback with the filter prop. This creates an alternative visual style that communicates to the user that the chip is selected.

mandatory.heading: Mandatory
mandatory.intro: Chip groups with mandatory prop must always have a value selected.

multiple.heading: Multiple
multiple.intro: Chip groups with multiple prop can have many values selected.

product.heading: Product card
product.intro: The v-chip component can have an explicit value used for its model. This gets passed to the v-chip-group component and is useful for when you donâ€™t want to use the chips index as their values.

toothbrush.heading: Toothbrush card
toothbrush.intro: Chip groups allow the creation of custom interfaces that perform the same actions as an item group or radio controls, but are stylistically different.
